explicit.modelviews

Class MDPView

  • java.lang.Object
    • explicit.modelviews.ModelView
      • explicit.modelviews.MDPView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MDP, MDPGeneric<java.lang.Double>, Model, NondetModel, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MDPAdditionalChoices, MDPDroppedAllChoices, MDPDroppedChoicesCached, MDPEquiv, MDPFromDTMC

    public abstract class MDPView
extends ModelView
implements MDP, java.lang.Cloneable
    Base class for an MDP view, i.e., a virtual MDP that is obtained by mapping from some other model on-the-fly.
    The main job of sub-classes is to provide an appropriate getTransitionsIterator() method. Several other methods, providing meta-data on the model have to be provided as well. For examples, see the sub-classes contained in this package.

      • mvDiscountedMultRewMinMaxSingle

        public double mvDiscountedMultRewMinMaxSingle(int s,
                                              double[] vect,
                                              MDPRewards mdpRewards,
                                              double discount,
                                              boolean min,
                                              int[] strat)
        Description copied from interface: MDP
        Do a single row of matrix-vector multiplication and sum of rewards followed by min/max. i.e. return min/max_k { rew(s) + rew_k(s) + discount*(sum_j P_k(s,j)*vect[j]) } Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.
        Specified by:
        mvDiscountedMultRewMinMaxSingle in interface MDP
        Parameters:
        s - Row index
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        mdpRewards - The rewards
        discount - The discount factor (in (0,1])
        min - Min or max for (true=min, false=max)
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)

      • mvDiscountedMultRewMinMax

        public void mvDiscountedMultRewMinMax(double[] vect,
                                      MDPRewards mdpRewards,
                                      boolean min,
                                      double[] result,
                                      double discount,
                                      java.util.BitSet subset,
                                      boolean complement,
                                      int[] strat)
        Description copied from interface: MDP
        Do a matrix-vector multiplication and sum of discounted rewards followed by min/max, i.e. one step of value iteration. i.e. for all s: result[s] = min/max_k { rew(s) + rew_k(s) + discount*(sum_j P_k(s,j)*vect[j]) } Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.
        Specified by:
        mvDiscountedMultRewMinMax in interface MDP
        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        mdpRewards - The rewards
        min - Min or max for (true=min, false=max)
        result - Vector to store result in
        discount - The discount factor (in (0,1])
        subset - Only do multiplication for these rows (ignored if null)
        complement - If true, subset is taken to be its complement (ignored if subset is null)
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)
